pullRequest.body:
We define and give basis API for circuits (minimal dependent sets) in matroids. 

---

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:

- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

`+ Indep.insert_circuit_of_forall_of_nontrivial`

`+ circuit_def`

<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12966606739/job/36167553310)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12966606739/job/36167553265)

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

```suggestion
* `Matroid.Circuit M C` means that `C` is minimally dependent in `M`.
```
Is this already formalized?
Yes, but currently just in my repo. It should be part of the next PR, so I thought that including the comment made sense as some general motivation for the notion of a circuit.
(I'm assuming by 'this' you are referring to the implied extensionality statement)

```suggestion
def Circuit (M : Matroid α) :=
  Minimal M.Dep

lemma circuit_def : M.Circuit C ↔ Minimal M.Dep C :=
  Iff.rfl
```
I usually put definitions and `rfl/Iff.rfl` proofs on a single line if possible, and this is compatible with the current style guide.
Maybe `C'`, `D`, or `X` should be better than `I`?

```suggestion
  nth_rw 2 [← insert_eq_of_mem he]
```
It seems like either this or the previous should be easy to prove in terms of the other?

This lemma looks like it ought to be generalised to something else: `M` is `Minimal P` iff `P M` and for every strict subset C of M, `P C` fails... And then this lemma should be one line in terms of that
`Dep` and `¬ Indep` aren't quite the same, for specific reasons to do with how matroids are implemented.
That's fair, but that should change it to a two-line proof in terms of the more general notion, instead of a one-line proof, or am I missing something?
Golfed slightly. The required rewrite is annoyingly tucked away behind binders.
I'd expect a similar general Minimal lemma would be useful here too
golfed. I added a lemma about `Minimal (¬ M.Indep ·)` to make this easier.

Are this one and the below useful in your applications? My expectation is that since they only apply in the empty or singleton case, either the two immediately preceding lemmas or just `simp` suffice instead... But I could be wrong

```suggestion
def IsCircuit (M : Matroid α) : Prop := Minimal M.Dep
```
Since this is a propositional statement, a name like `IsCircuit` would be more typical

Is the point that `Circuit` is a noun? The matroid predicates defined so far (`Base`, `Basis`, `Indep`) don't have `Is`, and this aligns with (for example) `LinearIndependent` and `Set.Finite`. 

If so, I don't think there's really a danger of ambiguity, and I'm worried about the cost in keystrokes.

We're moving (in a somewhat disorganized fashion) to a new extension of the naming convention where we prepend `Is` to props, so that it is clear from the name whether something is data-carrying or not.
`LinearIndependent` and `Set.Finite` should move over at some point, but this hasn't been done yet.
Is it recommended that I apply that here? I don't love having it for some and matroid predicates not others.
Ok, then let's merge as is. Then you can switch over the entire API in a future PR.

I think in some cases the current matroid convention makes it hard to guess what a name is about: for example it would be a lot clearer if [Matroid.Restriction](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/Matroid/Restrict.html#Matroid.Restriction) is renamed to `Matroid.IsRestrict`.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Data/Matroid/Circuit): Matroid circuits
